text:
Thanks <@UJJ239SC9>! That works. Maybe it was obvious for other people but it wasn’t clear for me in the API docs.

Thanks! You just saved me hours :pray:

is there a way to find all possible objectTypes/eventTypes etc for any given endpoint? They're not all listed in the API documentation, and some seem to have had name changes from what I'm guessing is previous API versions.
I know it is still in Beta, but is there any indication of when the validation rules on properties will be available through the API?

Hi Team,
I am building a HubSpot Integration to our product.
I implemented OAuth for our customer to integrate their HubSpot spot account's with our product. Let's say I have 5 different customer's who already integrated their HubSpot account's with my product.
My question is were these rate limits of 100 calls per 10 seconds for my oauth app in total? or its 100 calls for each access token in each one of those 5 customers?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/usage-details#rate-limits>.
Please help :pray: Let me know if any clarification is needed.

Found it Thanks!
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/OAuth-rate-limits-per-account-per-app-or-per-app/m-p/327592#M31676>
No problem. And I agree that it’s unclear. The other tricky thing is the variables get dropped from the sample code and are just blank spaces

Hi everyone,

I’m currently using a workflow to create a quote, associate a deal, associate lineitems, associate a company and associate a contact. Everything is working as expected except for the fact that the ‘Your information’ is not set. I do not see my personal information in the ‘Your info’ step and the company information is also missing. If I create a quote from the UI and select a deal, that data is set automatically.
What am I missing? I am setting a HubSpot owner ID through the API for my quote.
Which particular endpoint are you referring to?
I don't necessarily believe that it will affect it, but is the contact associated with a company? And is that the same company associated with the deal?
Hi Carter!
The man the myth the legend, Teun Rutten!
Yes they are associated, but I would expect HubSpot user info, not the associated contact or company
You’re the legend!
I would expect that also, was possibly thinking that the info might be pulled from the contact record instead of the deal record
I really want to test this out
The most common objecttypes are CONTACTS, COMPANIES, DEALS, TICKETS
And this is or is not a custom quote template?
Yeah! Custom template
Would you by chance want to dm me your template?
Odd thing is that if create a quote with the same deal and the same template through the UI, the ‘Your info’ is set
Ok cool cool
You want the code of my template?
I don't think it's neccesary now that we know that it's just when associating through the api
Pasted my code here, although I have 8 more coded actions afterwards
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Quotes-API-Automatically-set-Your-info/m-p/713831#M58407>

Thank you <@U01QVR44MEY>, those are thankfully mentioned in the documentation, but how about eventTypes for the events endpoint? The only one I've found mentioned is e_visited_page, how do I go about finding what others there are?
I just find it a bit strange that all possible parameters aren't listed somewhere, or am I just not finding them?
Interesting, the quotes want string values for the HubSpot_owner_id, I tried with a numerical value and it failed to associate the first time
Haha that is interesting!
My computer is being super slow right now while trying to load the docs, still running tests becuase that's obviously not the issue
I’m super confused what I’m missing. Not helpfull that the docs do not have all the properties
they never do
Not sure if this is a bug or just a missing property / association
I’m rebuilding this workflow for a demo vid today, so I’ll see if a different template would make a difference
HubSpot demo video? or for your team?
For socials!
But I don’t make videos using the clients portal :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
Love it, I'll try to get to the bottom of this as fast as possible
You’re the best!
Is there an API to get/set Theme Settings?
Hi Bradley, have you seen the Source Code API? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/source-code>
Something very strange is happening after creation <https://www.loom.com/share/dece8286dce04d59bd62fcb754243567>
They deal owner is associated for one moment then unassociated
<@UBT0AHWLD> yeah I used it before. But I don't know of a way I can change theme settings, other than reuploading the feilds.json
That’s really odd
does updating the fields.json not work?
Not if they've made changes to the settings in HubSpot
And I'm a super admin so it's not like I'm not a sales user
Is the same owner associated to the deal?
Well you first need to create the quote before associating the deal
And that's when I noticed that the owner was being removed after a couple of seconds
The f
Very strange, I'm still digging into it
Hello everyone, I will appreciate the assistance if anyone can help me. Is it possible to send/receive messages/calls from HubSpot using a Skype integration?

<https://www.linkedin.com/posts/kyleanthonyjepson_HubSpottipsandtricks-HubSpot-crm-activity-6993913563132088320-Cmam?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop|https://www.linkedin.com/posts/kyleanthonyjepson_HubSpottipsandtricks-HubSpot-crm-act[…]563132088320-Cmam?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop>

Hi everyone,
I am experiencing trouble with the HubSpot (forms) tracking code. When I turn the non-HubSpot forms on, it automatically updates also other properties (such as phone numbers) in our own platform. Has anyone experienced this before and knows how to let the tracking code just "track" instead of "update"? Many thanks in advance :smiley:
Yeah I noticed that one! Really cool!
Sad that you can not create lineitems when a deal is created.

G'day, I have a bit of an issue with an app here. On my account settings, I'm using a custom webhook and whatnot and this works on a dev portal. But when I'm in a production portal it doesn't work. Not only doesn't it work, it doesn't even register that something has been sent, meaning there is no log of an api call
This message was deleted.
I have some news

```hs_sender_image_url
hs_sender_company_name
hs_sender_firstname
hs_sender_company_domain
hs_sender_lastname
hs_sender_company_address
hs_sender_email
hs_sender_company_address2
hs_sender_phone
hs_sender_company_city
hs_sender_jobtitle
hs_sender_company_state
hs_sender_company_zip
hs_sender_company_country
hs_sender_company_image_url```
All these properties aren't dynamically set based on the HubSpot_owner_id when creating through the api, they only get set when creating the through the ui, so you'll have to manually set them.
Bloody hell
Can we set them through the API?
Yes
Awesome, but sucks that this is necessary
also I found that if you send a patch request right after the create request the owner will stay assigned
Lol
Can you post this on my community post? So I can give you the credits you deserve
Hahaha sure
It's kinda stupid, I'll mention it to the team
Please do! I'm going to tag anyone who can scream at the product team
<@UD53A9UUR>
PRODUCT!
:joy: :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
I CCed dennis the other day, it felt magical
<@U2H3TT8F2> or <@UD53A9UUR> can this be added to the docs?
Mentioning <@UD53A9UUR> in anything feels magical
:eyes:
flattery will get you everywhere
:brain:
but mentioning <@U2H3TT8F2> gets you demerits
i will review this MASSIVE thread in a bit!
Haha sucks to be you Tuen, do not mention the boss
Also can `HubSpot_owner_id` be switched to `hs_owner_id` like everything else?
Jeez
~We're~ I'm high maintenance
We're*
You should see my DM's to Dennis
I can imagine, because of my dms
I’m here to help!!
Well dang, it’s been solved! :smile:
:rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
I think the search API can help you <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search>

Hi all! Is it possible to create an SMS engagement through APIs? There's no documentation on it but I can create an SMS engagement manually from within HubSpot. I actually tried creating SMS engagements using <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/engagements/create_engagement|this API> and got a 200 successful response, but they don't actually appear inside of HubSpot. Here is a sample response:

```{
   associationCreateFailures: [],
   engagement: {
     id: 27496250765,
     portalId: 20714904,
     active: true,
     createdAt: 1667500219191,
     lastUpdated: 1667500219191,
     type: 'SMS',
     timestamp: 1664806291000,
     allAccessibleTeamIds: [],
     queueMembershipIds: []
   },
   associations: {
     contactIds: [ 20502 ],
     companyIds: [],
     dealIds: [],
     ownerIds: [],
     workflowIds: [],
     ticketIds: [],
     contentIds: [],
     quoteIds: [],
     marketingEventIds: []
   },
   attachments: [ { id: 20502 } ],
   metadata: { conversationsChannelIds: [], conversationsChannelInstanceIds: [] }
}```
I have no idea what is happening, it looks like HubSpot is 'hiding' SMSs that are created using the engagements api <https://www.loom.com/share/e292ba5e63b24024bee909f886f4c45c>

That is SUPER interesting. They clearly have gotten far enough along that the API supports SMS but they are intentionally hiding it like you said. Guess theres nothing to be done for now haha. Thanks!
For sure, I'm also very interested

Hi, I was wondering if we are able to find out where the calls are coming from that are using our current API Key? We are working on moving to Private Apps but we don't know which of our apps use our API key. I see a list of call logs in our HubSpot account but no information on where it's coming from. If there is no way to know where the calls are coming from, are there any suggestions on what we can do when we move to the private app?
Like are you looking for an ip address?

Not IP address, but as in the apps that we are using our API key on. Like if it is coming from Recurly, Zapier, etc. For example, I found this video from HubSpot showing that their Postman app uses the API Key, so they had to change the API key in their Postman's code to the new Private app code. <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F3Qd9Hp4giM>

But since we do not know which of our apps are connected, we don't know which app to go into to change the API Key to the Private App code.
Good question; I don't believe there is a way , atleast that isn't "easy" though. My suggestion would be to just replace everything with bearer tokens first then disable the API Keys
Yes, there really isn't a way to figure out if the request is coming from zapier or recurly, because on the backend they are using the same api and not doing anything different.

Hi there HS community!

Is there any way to filter by a *date-time stamp AND include associations* from any endpoint for any object or engagement? (I’m trying my best to avoid having to make additional calls when syncing data in the integration I’m working on, and currently I don’t see any endpoint that supports both filtering by any date time stamp AND including associations....so as of now I’d have to search the CRM for any new/updated records for say ‘companies’ in the past 10minutes since the last sync, and then grab all of those record IDs and make a second request PER RECORD for the associations, and then a 3rd request for the property values i’m wanting to pull into the original object to begin with.

I’ve found a workaround where i can only use the Search the CRM functionality and include associated record properties...but the ‘solution’ involves using workflows in the UI to leverage copying and setting property values from one ‘source’ object to a ‘destination’ object which works! But it won’t if the HS account in questions is free or a starter....as those tiers don’t have workflows....It also only works for CRM objects as I don’t see a way to make custom properties/fields for engagements? :thinking_face:

Any thoughts or suggestions?

The use case is simple….say i’m looking at a ‘meeting’ I want to know who the contact or company is associated with the meeting….as of now i can grab any new or updated meetings in the past 10minutes, but if i want a single array of these ‘meetings’ with un-nested objects per meeting showing the contact and company associated I have to SEARCH the CRM, search for each individual meeting and include associations PER meeting, then a third/fourth request for the contact and company to pull those names into the ‘meeting object’ i’m building out.
The cleanest way for sure would be to leverage graphql
yeah what Carter said 100%
Aww man, I see :disappointed: Ok, thank you for the responses!

:wave: Hello, team!
i' trying to send a custom object records and get back the data from another CRM with status on this data with API , can you guys lead me how to do it please
